aboutMe.description: My name is Quentin Aslan, and I'm a 25-year-old Full-Stack software engineer. My passion for technology started in my adolescence, and I've been developing professional websites since 2015.

aboutMe.networkManagement: My expertise extends to network management and Linux system administration.
aboutMe.collaborationDescription: I thrive in collaborative environments, working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver robust, user-friendly solutions.
aboutMe.learning: Passionate about continuous learning and new technologies, I aim to create impactful and innovative software.

keyAchievements: Led the complete redesign of a critical B2B application for Bell, improving functionality and user experience.
Developed a scalable and reusable frontend architecture with VueJS 3 and Pinia.
Enhanced proficiency in Figma by working closely with UX design teams.
Successfully managed and collaborated in a large, cross-functional team using Agile methodologies.
Integrated advanced user tracking with Matomo, providing valuable insights into application usage.
moreDetails: Worked closely with UX teams to ensure seamless integration of design and functionality.
Implemented unit testing and CI/CD pipelines to ensure code quality and efficient deployment
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to gather and implement feedback, improving the overall user experience.
Utilized Agile methodology to manage project timelines and deliverables effectively.
Conducted technical presentations to demonstrate new features and functionalities to stakeholders.
Technologies Used: VueJS 3, Pinia, SASS, Figma, Matomo, Java Spring, Azure DevOps, GitLab.

keyAchievements: Created an application for configuring Linux routers , used by multiple companies including the National Center for Space Research (CNES) in France or The France's stadium.
Designed and implemented REST APIs with Node.js and integrated them with MongoDB.
Built responsive user interfaces using Vue.js, Bootstrap, and jQuery.
Implemented unit testing and CI/CD pipelines, ensuring robust and efficient development processes.
Managed the complete product development cycle, from requirements gathering to production deployment.
Developed a JavaScript-based 3D model viewer using the BIM (Building Information Modeling) approach.

easyRouter.mainDescription: The Easy Router Project is a web application designed to simplify the configuration of a travel router setup on a Raspberry Pi.
easyRouter.subDescription: The extension allows users to interact with a form on Amazon product pages, helping them create affiliate links directly from the product page. I also developed the extensionâ€™s popup, where users can log in and access the same React features found on the product page.

archerAffiliate.title: Archer Affiliate
archerAffiliate.location: I was at Boston, USA ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸
archerAffiliate.mainDescription: A Chrome extension that adds React components to Amazon product pages, making it easy for users to create affiliate links for Archer Affiliate.
archerAffiliate.subDescription: For this project, I used Plasmo, a great framework that makes building Chrome extensions easier, similar to Next.js, but designed for browser extensions.
